SEARCH
Package oop2.jeopardy.logging

Class GameEventLogger

java.lang.Object
oop2.jeopardy.logging.GameEventLogger
public class GameEventLogger extends Object
Handles writing structured gameplay events to a CSV log file.

This class automatically:

  • Maintains a persistent game counter (GAME001, GAME002, ...)
  • Ensures the log directory and CSV header exist
  • Appends event entries in a clean, commaâ€“safe format
The output is stored under reports/logs by default, but this may be overridden using the system property log.folder.override.

Used for audit trails, debugging, and producing game analytics reports.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Kadie Bisnath - 816036090

  • Field Details

    • LOG_FOLDER

      private static final String LOG_FOLDER
      Base folder where logs are written. Can be overridden via JVM property.

    • LOG_FILE

      private static final String LOG_FILE
      Name of the CSV file where events are recorded.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TS_FORMAT

      private static final DateTimeFormatter TS_FORMAT
      Timestamp format for all logged entries.

    • caseId

      private final String caseId
      Unique ID assigned to the current game session (GAME001, GAME002, ...).

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEventLogger

      public GameEventLogger()
      Creates a new logger instance.

      This constructor:

      • Loads and increments the persistent game counter
      • Generates a formatted case ID (e.g., GAME007)
      • Ensures the CSV log file exists and has its header

  • Method Details

    • loadAndIncrementGameNumber

      private int loadAndIncrementGameNumber()
      Loads the game counter from game_counter.txt, increments it, writes back the updated value, and returns the new game number.
      Returns:
      the incremented game number; defaults to 1 on error

    • ensureHeaderExists

      private void ensureHeaderExists()
      Ensures the CSV log file exists and contains the required header row.

      If the file does not exist, it is created with the following columns: 

       Case_ID,Player_ID,Activity,Timestamp,Category,
 Question_Value,Answer_Given,Result,Score_After_Play

    • log

      public void log(String playerId, String activity, String category, String questionValue, String answer, String result, String scoreAfter)
      Appends a single event entry to the CSV log.
      Parameters:
      playerId - ID or name of the player performing the action
      activity - description of the event (e.g., "SELECT", "ANSWERED", "RESULT")
      category - question category (or blank)
      questionValue - value of the question (e.g., "200")
      answer - the player's answer text
      result - outcome: "CORRECT" or "WRONG"
      scoreAfter - player's running score after the event

    • safe

      private String safe(String s)
      Sanitizes a string for CSV output by replacing commas with spaces and converting null values to empty strings.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to sanitize
      Returns:
      a safe CSV-compatible string
